meanings.definition: A rubber covering, typically inflated with air, placed around a wheel to form a soft contact with the road.
meanings.sent1: The tyre on the bike was black and round.
meanings.sent2: The car's tyre needed air because it was flat.
meanings.sent3: The tyre rolled away down the hill on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a tyre spinning out of control.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt rubber filled the air as the tyre screeched to a stop.

meanings.definition: To fit a tyre to a wheel.
meanings.sent1: He will tyre the new wheel before the race.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to tyre a bicycle at a young age.
meanings.sent3: Don't tyre yourself out trying to change the tyre!
meanings.sent4: The mechanic will tyre the car quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: After a long day, he finally managed to tyre the spare wheel.

meanings.definition: A metal hoop forming the tread of a wheel.
meanings.sent1: The tyre of the old wagon was rusty and worn.
meanings.sent2: The tractor's tyre had intricate patterns for traction.
meanings.sent3: The children used the tyre as a swing in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The tyre of the unicycle gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The tyre left tracks in the mud as the car drove off-road.
